p: Survival of homo sapiens against traumas from foreign pathogenic microorganisms depend on the status of their immune defense mechanisms. It is well established that the immune system safeguards the host against attacks from infective microorganism such as virus, allergic or toxic molecules ( Chaplin, 2010). Once a defect occurs within the immune system, it results in response impairment against infectious agents. The cause of impairment (immunosuppression) can be either intrinsic (inherited) or extrinsic and referred to as primary or secondary immunodeficiency respectively ( Abbas etÂ al., 2016; Chinen and Shearer, 2010).
